As a moderator of this forum, I'd prefer we don't start labeling some 
discussions "Not Samurai Related", because then that opens the door 
for hundreds of completely off-topic posts.  As long as a topic is 
even vaguely or marginally related to Japanese history or culture or 
Japan or Japanese, it is free to go (and I think that gives a lot of 
leeway in discussion, and I'm not against history-related posts that 
are more or less off-topic).  Allowing a free-reign of completely off-
topic posts opens a can of worms I'd prefer to avoid.

Thanks

--- In samuraihistory@yahoogroups.com, tom helm <junkmail@t...> wrote:
> Nate et al-
> 	My point was that it is a little hypocritical to say it is ok 
> to chat about mopeds because they are Japanese, but not politics 
> because they are European. After all the discussion of European 
> history and politics started from a posting about things Japanese 
and 
> may well have returned to that subject in time.
> 	This list has been quiet for so long I thought it was dead. 
> Once people are talking we ought to be able to draw the 
conversation 
> into areas more on topic. The Swiss are the Pope's samurai don't 
you 
> know...
> -t
